packagegui.name: spamdsettings
packagegui.title: SpamD: Settings

field.description: These are the interfaces SpamD will intercept SMTP connections on.
The SMTP version banner that is reported upon initial connection.

The maximum number of concurrent blacklisted connections to allow in greylisting mode. This value must not be greater than 'Max Concurrent Connections' (see below).
(Default: 'Max Concurrent Connections' - 100)

The maximum number of concurrent connections to allow.
(Default: 800)

Connections from addresses not blacklisted on the black lists tab will be considered for greylisting. Such connections will not be stuttered at (see the 'Stutter Secs' option) or delayed, and will receive the pleasantly innocuous temporary failure. After passtime elapsed, the host will be added to the white list upon reconnection.

After specified number of minutes, if SpamD sees a retried attempt to deliver mail for the same tuple, it will whitelist the connecting address by adding it as a whitelist entry.
(Default: 25 minutes)

SpamD removes connection entries from the database if delivery has not been retried within specified numbers of hours from the initial time a connection is seen.
(Default: 4 hours)

SpamD removes whitelist entries from the database if no mail delivery activity has been seen from the whitelisted address within specified number of hours from the initial time an address is whitelisted.
(Default: 864 hours - approximately 36 days)

Stutter at greylisted connections for the specified amount of seconds, after which the connection is not stuttered at.
(Defaults: 10 seconds)

Delay each character sent to the client by the specified amount of seconds.
(Default: 1 second)
Set the socket receive buffer to this many bytes, adjusting the window size.

After processing, automatically send messages to specified IP Address. You may enter an alias if you like, simply prepend $ to the alias name.
(Example: $mailservers)
Note: If you have postfix package installed, enter 127.0.0.1 here.
